numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Other people have already mentioned this.
2. I also noticed this.
3. Younger generations tend to be more optimistic about the future of their country.
4. Adults generally have more negative views about the future of their country.
5. The survey covered 21 countries.
6. In 12 of the 21 countries, more than 50% of youths believed that the world was becoming a better place.
7. A youth is a person who is between 15 years and 24 years old.
8. Adults were also surveyed.
9. An adult is a person who is 40 years old or older.
10. In only 6 of the 21 countries, the majority of surveyed adults demonstrated an overall positive mindset.
11. There is a disparity in world view between older generations and younger generations.
12. I ask a question.
13. The question is why older generations have generally negative outlooks on life.
14. The question is also why younger generations perceive a brighter future.
15. I wonder what factors contribute to the attitudes of a country's populace.
16. Bie B. Sea is a person.
17. Bie B. Sea is from Taihu Lake.
18. Bie B. Sea cited recent economic growth as a potential cause for Indonesia's largely positive mindset.
19. Other people pointed to societal pressures as a reason for more negative mindsets.
20. Stresses of the education system are an example of societal pressures.
